comments.body: @yaooqinn Thank you. But I don't know the reason. Could you tell me why?

@yaooqinn, I think you had to try with fully qualified name like `[[org.apache.spark.sql.AnalysisException]]` because regular classes should be able to use in Unidoc, but not `trait`s. in general.

There are still a bit of buggy behaviours in Unidoc even for the regular classes. In this case, you can use `` `AnalysisException` ``.

Yes I had tested the full class name.

I used AnalysisException directly w/o `` because it was AnalysisException before it changed to [[AnalysisException]]. I also believe `AnalysisException` is better

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +32,36 @@/**
 * Object for grouping all error messages of the query compilation.
 * Currently it includes all AnalysisExceptions.
 */
object QueryCompilationErrors {
